column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Communicate With Younger People
#Text=When you are speaking to a young person , keep in mind that at one time that you were that age , too , and that nobody young or old likes to be talked down to .
#Text=Remember how you wanted older people to treat you , and act accordingly .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Do n't make a young person feel that he or she is young or stupid .
#Text=Instead , try to pay attention to what the person is saying and respect what 's on his or her mind .
#Text=Try to answer any questions as best you can , and not in a condescending manner .
#Text=Try not to poke fun at the way that a younger person may dress , for we all at one time or another went through stylish trends .
#Text=If you are a parent , this matter definitely , is handled differently , especially since you are likely paying for the outfits that your children are wearing .
#Text=You should definitely care about how they look and what message they are sending to others .
#Text=If you are a parent , try hard not to try to relive your life through your child or children .
#Text=In other words , do n't try to force your daughter to become a cheerleader just because you missed out on it ... make sure that is what she wants to do .
#Text=Do n't force your son to play football or baseball just because you love sports , or missed out in participating in sports .
#Text=Listen to what your child or children may be interested in .
#Text=Do n't force your children to study to the point that they have n't any time at all for themselves .
#Text=They need to have some time to enjoy being young ; as long as they are doing their homework that should be good enough .
#Text=Avoid preaching ; you 'll be amazed how much more attentive young people will be .
#Text=Be careful on how that you speak to a young person about drugs , drinking , smoking and so forth ... do n't preach , but mention it and let it go .
#Text=You 'll be letting them know that you are concerned without being overbearing and pushing them into dangerous , rebellious activities .
#Text=Speak to your children honestly about sex .
#Text=If they appear to be listening , but are giggling at the same time , they most likely are not having sex yet .
#Text=Be sincere , and answer any questions that might arise .
#Text=Do n't always take a teacher 's side .
#Text=If your child is having trouble in a class , listen to your child about how he or she feels about a teacher .
#Text=Your child may work better on a one to one basis ; he or she may need more explaining about a subject , than the teacher is taking the time to give .
#Text=Go to school and meet the teacher in question .
#Text=Do n't knock a young person that does n't get all A 's .
#Text=As long as the child does his or her best , a few B 's or C 's are not a big deal .
#Text=A younger person may not be good in one subject , but great in another .
#Text=When you see a lower grade on your child 's report card , simply ask , " Are you putting forth your best effort on this subject ?
#Text=The fact is , things are n't the way they were when you were young and complaining wo n't change that .
#Text=Do n't complain about the types of entertainment that are popular today .
#Text=That can get old fast .
#Text=Tips
#Text=Try to be of help with your child 's studies , if you can , meaning if it is a subject that you know .
#Text=You should be able to tell if they need help ... think about other means of help , if you can not be of assistance .
#Text=If you want to spend some quality time with your son or daughter , niece or nephew , simply ask what they might enjoy doing together .
#Text=Do n't try acting cool , like going to a Rock Concert , unless you do enjoy that kind of thing ( and above all , do n't use their slang words .
#Text=Learn them so that you understand what they 're talking about , but do n't try to sound like a kid ) .
#Text=You may want to suggest going to see a movie that may be interesting to both of you ; plus there 's bowling , or even going to the park , maybe for a nice bike ride ... take a picnic lunch .
#Text=Younger people love going to game rooms , but do you ?
#Text=Try to pick something that both of you will be relaxed doing and enjoy together .
#Text=Activities the young person 's good at are a great choice .
#Text=Always be nice to the kids in your neighborhood .
#Text=News travels quickly among our younger people , and in time they will speak of you in a nice manner ... and will wave to you while out riding their bikes and so forth .
#Text=A friendly " Hello or Hi " goes a long way .
#Text=It is sometimes hard trying to be a parent and friend to your child at the same time .
#Text=It is very important to first be a parent , but that does n't mean that you ca n't listen like a friend .
#Text=Agree to disagree on some issues that become circular arguments .
#Text=You do n't need to impose your food tastes , musical choices , personal opinions of actresses or politicians on young people .
#Text=They may have good reasons of their own to disagree and fighting over trivial issues just ruins both of your day .
#Text=Drop the topic of that lousy movie or book the kid adores once you 've had one thorough discussion on it .
#Text=Warnings
#Text=Never try to impose anything unless its needed .
#Text=Try to explain things trivially , remember they are young people .
